image.altText: A display for a soldier in a war memorial.

props.synopsis: The war memorial's revised display now mentions Ben Roberts-Smith's failed bid to the High Court.

title.children: Australian War Memorial updates Ben Roberts-Smith display a third time

image.altText: Bruce walks outside, flanked by others, wearing a blue suit, white shirt and pink tie and glasses.

props.synopsis: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann launches Federal Court action seeking funding for legal representation at a National Anti-Corruption Commission hearing after raids on his home in June last year.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann seeks funds for legal representation over 2024 raids

image.altText: An aerial view of a golf course with suburban houses around its edge.

props.synopsis: With the ACT government pushing for greater urban density, golf courses in inner Canberra suburbs are becoming attractive sites for redevelopment to provide much-needed housing and a way for struggling clubs to bolster their budgets.

title.children: 'Sustainable development': Golf course reimagined for club and housing

image.altText: People on chair lift in the snow wearing ski gear

props.synopsis: The general sentiment is Australia's ski resorts are coming to the end of a bumper snow season — but is this evaluation accurate, or just positive spin after the dismal 2023 and 2024 seasons?

title.children: The real story of the 2025 snow season is no winter wonderland

image.altText: A small white capsule tablet sits in between rulers measuring its size, which have "CanTEST" written on them.

props.synopsis: The capsuled white powder was presented to the pill-testing site on Friday and, when chemists there couldn't make an identification, transferred to the Australian National University for analysis.

title.children: Rare nitazene found in Canberra believed to be Australian first

image.altText: A six-lane road bridge across a lake with a strip in the middle.

props.synopsis: Many Canberrans travel across it every day, but major upgrades addressing the structural safety of the Commonwealth Avenue Bridge are set to create two years of significant traffic disruption.

title.children: Commonwealth Avenue Bridge upgrade likely to cause commuter chaos

image.altText: ACT Magistrate Court

props.synopsis: Three alleged kidnappers were trying to recover a $200,000 debt from a 52-year-old man in Monash on September 21, a court has heard, while rejecting their bail application.

title.children: Alleged kidnappers trying to recover $200,000, court hears

image.altText: Four packs of off-brand cigarettes sitting next to a red lighter on an outdoor green metal table.

props.synopsis: Doctors say smoking rates are at levels they haven't seen in a decade due to easy access to illegal cigarettes that are a "quarter of the price" of legal cigarettes.

title.children: Concerns illegal cigarettes easy to access and cheaper

image.altText: Brown Header

props.synopsis: Eight days into her new role as interim vice-chancellor at the Australian National University, Rebekah Brown sat down for an exclusive ABC interview to share her plan for getting the institution back on track.

title.children: How the ANU's interim leader wants to turn its reputation around

image.altText: A freeze frame of a football replay on an old style TV

props.synopsis: The Purnim Bears were supposed to be the feel-good story of country football — a team uniting black and white communities. But their 1987 grand final was so violent it ended with their expulsion.

title.children: The premiership team that won it all and was banned after one perfect season

image.altText: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr speaking at a podium with President Donald Trump standing behind him.

props.synopsis: The US government has announced a drug named leucovorin will be approved to treat symptoms of autism in some children. So what is the drug, and is there any evidence to support its use?

title.children: What is leucovorin, the drug Trump claims can help treat autism?

image.altText: A stack of pills on a table

props.synopsis: Some leading Australian experts in medicine, autism research and obstetrics say the US president's claims are "a misreading of science," or at worst, "a misuse". Here's why.

title.children: Five experts on Trump's paracetamol and autism claims

image.altText: A woman with a green top sits at a desk with paperwork and phone, her hair is over her face and hand on the side of head.

props.synopsis: COVID showed just how "fragile" our economic security is. As artificial intelligence potentially takes jobs from humans, a universal basic income might be a solution.

title.children: Money for everyone an option as AI opens the door for basic income

image.altText: A sign pointing to Kalgoorlie from Coolgardie.

props.synopsis: More than 15,000 homes and businesses were without electricity after the entire town of Kalgoorlie-Boulder lost power.

title.children: Massive power blackout shuts down Kalgoorlie-Boulder again

image.altText: A black-and-white photo of Herbert Vere Evatt, taken in close-up, he is smiling and holding a pencil in the air

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese formally recognised Palestinian statehood on the world stage this week, but about 78 years ago a lesser-known Australian was fighting for the creation of a Jewish state.

title.children: The Australian 'domestic failure' who was key in the Israel-Palestine partition

image.altText: Two men in suits sitting down with a white and blue flag and red, navy and white flag behind them

props.synopsis: The US president criticised Russia on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly, saying it had been fighting "aimlessly" in a war that a "real military power" would have won in less than a week.

title.children: Ukraine can win back all territory lost to Russia, Trump says

image.altText: Apple cider vinegar being poured into a spoon.

props.synopsis: A scientific journal has retracted a study that claimed apple cider vinegar rivalled Ozempic as a weight-loss agent.

title.children: Controversial apple cider vinegar weight-loss study retracted

image.altText: Julia Yarzar  holds up a bottle of liquid melatonin

props.synopsis: The ABC has analysed data from poisons hotlines across the country, revealing almost 1,500 calls were made about children taking melatonin last year, a dramatic rise on previous figures.

title.children: 'Purely luck' no-one has died after dramatic rise in melatonin use, experts warn

image.altText: A person holding a mobile phone surrounded by icons from social media platforms

props.synopsis: WhatsApp, Roblox, Reddit and Discord are among an expanded list of platforms which may be covered by the teen social media ban, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: Not just 'big fish': eSafety reveals new platforms may be forced to ban teens

image.altText: A dark haired man in a wheelchair sits behind the open driver's door of a car.

props.synopsis: Josh Evans, who uses a wheelchair, had to turn down a job with the Bureau of Meteorology because he was unable to get NDIS funding for a vehicle to drive himself to work.

title.children: Man knocks back dream job after NDIS rejects van to drive to work

image.altText: A building with grey, green and brown colouring and the words 'Edge Early Learning'

props.synopsis: A childcare centre in Adelaide's inner south-west has been ordered to close for two weeks after being handed an emergency action notice following claims children were left unsupervised.

title.children: Childcare centre temporarily shut amid claims children were left unsupervised

image.altText: close up sign of Optus

props.synopsis: The federal government has yet to pass legislation to empower a new coordinator for the emergency services line, but experts say tougher conditions are needed on the telco itself.

title.children: Incoming triple-0 reforms may not have helped prevent Optus failure

image.altText: A section of a rocket at the Kennedy Space Centre.

props.synopsis: NASA's first crewed flight in its Artemis program — a trip around the Moon and back — is on track for launch in April 2026 and could potentially be moved up to February, the space agency says.

title.children: Artemis program on track to take astronauts around the Moon: NASA

image.altText: A man scores a try during a rugby league match, while another from the opposite team kneels behind.

props.synopsis: On Sunday, the Broncos and Panthers will face off in the finals for the first time since the 2023 grand final, but the memory of that night still hangs over both sides.

title.children: Ahead of Broncos-Panthers, the legacy of the 2023 grand final still endures

image.altText: Lots of hands reaching for the footy against a black background.

props.synopsis: Ahead of the AFL grand final, national violence prevention organisation Our Watch is calling for the sporting community to address the increased risk of violence facing women during football finals.

title.children: Domestic violence services brace for spike on AFL grand final weekend

image.altText: water envelops a bench.

props.synopsis: The storm, which is the most powerful so far in 2025, is now heading towards the Chinese mainland, prompting widespread disruption and warnings of sea surges.

title.children: Super Typhoon Ragasa lashes Taiwan, with 14 dead and 124 missing

image.altText: Rugby player sprinting clear with the ball, looking over his shoulder to see potential defenders

props.synopsis: Wallabies fullback Andrew Kellaway will miss Saturday's Bledisloe Cup Test match against the All Blacks in Auckland, ruled out with a calf strain.

title.children: Wallabies lose another fullback ahead of Bledisloe showdown

image.altText: Harold 'Dickie' Bird poses with his OBE award, wearing a blue suit

props.synopsis: One of international cricket's most recognised umpires is being remembered for his "fairness, humour and love of the game".

title.children: Cricket umpiring great Dickie Bird dies aged 92

image.altText: A young man with shoulder-length red hair and a young woman with braided blonde hair.

props.synopsis: Jack and Anna swapped the humidity of Queensland for chilly days in Tasmania, but is Tasmania really the climate refuge many think it is?

title.children: 'This is not normal': Australians moving to Tasmania to escape climate heat

image.altText: A close up photo of a middle aged Caucasian man with blond hair.

props.synopsis: A man accused of trying to assassinate Donald Trump at his Florida golf course last year has been found guilty on all charges.

title.children: 'Justice is served': Trump praises guilty verdict in attempted assassination case

image.altText: Man in NSW police uniform, blurry people either side of him

props.synopsis: Deputy Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon has been chosen to head up the NSW Police Force, replacing commissioner Karen Webb.

title.children: Incoming NSW Police boss says he has learnt from past 'mistakes'

image.altText: There is a sunrise with lots of different colors over the beach with two people standing at the water.

props.synopsis: It's the same question every year: Do we gain or lose an hour when daylight saving time comes into effect in October? Here's what you need to know.

title.children: Daylight saving time is about to start. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: Vladimir Putin sitting in the Kremlin.

props.synopsis: The report is based on detailed interviews with 215 former detainees captured since Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine in 2022.

title.children: Russia systematically torturing Ukrainian civilians, UN says

image.altText: Woman speed skydiving from plane

props.synopsis: Jumping out of planes and freefalling at nearly 500 kilometres per hour is "addictive" for Queensland woman Natisha Dingle, who has just set a new Oceania speed record in the sport.

title.children: Australian speed skydiver hangs on to title of fastest woman in the world

image.altText: Passengers crowd around waiting at Parramatta train station

props.synopsis: A review into Sydney's train chaos in May was scathing. So how will the government fix the city's ailing rail network?

title.children: How NSW government plans to fix Sydney's rail network
